column5: I was out Saturday for a few hours and managed to boat & release 5 pike-nothing huge but averaging about 24".  I also landed what I think was a tiger? The lake has both pike and muskie as I've caught both personally.  What's the consensus?  Out of curiosity, what are the regs on a tiger muskie...pike season and limits or muskie?
Muskie limits and season for Tigers
I say tiger.  It seems like when pike recently invade muskie water, tigers are more common.
Nice catch!  That's a super pretty fish
I'll say it's a pike, juveniles often have that barred appearance turning to spotted as they mature and the fins look too rounded for a hybrid.

I'll say it's a pike, juveniles often have that barred appearance turning to spotted as they mature and the fins look too rounded for a hybrid.  Hybrids have rounded fins.  Only pure muskies have pointed fins and tail.

I'd say tiger and a beauty fish too.  Rounded tail, markings on the cheek and the "tiger strips" are a good give away. (Chin pores are another) I hope all is well in the Hammer, great to see you getting some water time in.
I think that's a bit big to still be a juvenile pike with the vertical stripes.  I'd guess Tiger.

I'd say tiger and a beauty fish too.  Rounded tail, markings on the cheek and the "tiger strips" are a good give away. (Chin pores are another) I hope all is well in the Hammer, great to see you getting some water time in. Things are great, and an interesting debate-as I half expected   . In any event a pretty cool looking fish.  Maybe due for a repeat visit to Cameron?
I'll just leave this here.....(I'm with the tiger guys)
.  Maybe due for a repeat visit to Cameron? That would be great!  It's been far too long since the last one.
